message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void printShapes(ArrayList<String> numbers){
  Iterator<Shape> iter = this.shapes.iterator();
  for(String s:numbers){
    if(iter.hasNext()){
      Shape shape = iter.next();
      shape.printMe(s);
    }
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue in your code is that you are creating a new iterator in every iteration of the loop. This causes the iterator to always start from the beginning of the list, resulting in the same shape (Circle) being printed for every number. To fix this, you should move the creation of the iterator outside of the loop and check if it has a next element before calling next(). This way, the iterator will continue from where it left off in each iteration.
